content: Just as the crypto industry is expanding and getting local adoption from individuals, co-operations, organisations and few countries  the same rate at which we have crypto enthusiast increasing in number which i see so worrisome and also a call for major concern. Reason been that as more people get involved in the crypto business the more scammers are likely to increase their technique and the more scammers get recruited. Staying off scammers path will require been well informed of their every new technique the can ever deploy against their potential victim.To stay off scammers path users mustAvoid phishing linksNever invest in a project without a well structured communityPay close attention to the engagement within the community for suspicious activitiesEnsure you assets are off CEXWhat will you like to add  to this?

comments.body: Remember, when it is a too good to be true offer, it usually is and act accordingly. comments.body: Quote from: Alisha-k on September 18, 2022, 07:45:00 AMWhat will you like to add  to this?* Be more smart and less greedy        * Don't jump into a project/coin only based on the hype from advertisers (especially twitter)        * Avoid any "too good to be true" investment        * Avoid send me 1$ and I'll send back 2$ scams, no matter how reputable is the account calling for that* Protect your coins (keep your coins on your wallet, use hardware wallet where possible, never give out wallet's seed, keep backup seed offline)

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Scammers will always assume that as more individuals join the cryptocurrency community, there are many people who haven't learned the fundamentals of being here and how to protect themselves from attacks from people like them. As a result, they develop a unique scamming technique that differs from the usual ones. The majority of scam victims are newbies since they are so readily seduced, especially those looking for quick cash. To avoid being duped, people should recognize a red flag when they encounter one.To add to the list:- Enable Two-factor authentication for all your accounts- Using of firewalls- Installing an upto date anti virus software- Use strong passwords and yet easily accessible ones for your convenience- Stay away from malicious links or attachments you come across on the web- Make sure your private keys are well stored and in hard wallet- Make sure your passwords are not vulnerable online to attacks i.e don’t store passwords online or any website.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Stop being greedy and you're likely to avoid most of the scammers. These scammers are offering those crazy returns and you're being encouraged because of it.But if you're going to think of it and avoid that attitude of being greedy then you can potentially avoid them at most time because you're all set and you won't show them that you're interested of earning a lot from their offers.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: I also notice that a lot of people posing as "crypto brokers" are on the rise. This is the easiest scam to spot on and easiest to avoid since you can just say no to these brokers trying to force their service unto you and they'll be gone. However a lot of people still fall prey to these people albeit the warnings and the heads up. No matter how much you educate people on these things, they'd still believe that they will always know better than you and still follow their decision anyway. Greed is what drives these people to ruin and if they can't control their greed, then they'll eventually fall into a lot more scams.
